testStep.functionId: Step 1 CONFIGURE: Determine the URL for the WSDL file that will be used for this test. RECORD this information as: WSDLFile = ${WSDLFile}

Step 2 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the SOAP over HTTP sub-profile Request-Response pattern is required by the specification. (NRTM 1.a). RECORD this information as: NTCIP2306_N1R1_WSDL_Request_Response_Flag = ${NTCIP2306_N1R1_WSDL_Request_Response_Flag}

Step 3 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the SOAP over HTTP sub-profile Subscription-Publication pattern is required by the specification. (NRTM 1.b). RECORD this information as: NTCIP2306_N1R2_WSDL_Subscription_Publication_Flag = ${NTCIP2306_N1R2_WSDL_Subscription_Publication_Flag}

Step 4 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the XML over HTTP sub-profile Request-Only pattern is required by the specification. (NRTM 2.a). RECORD this information as: NTCIP2306_N2R6_WSDL_Request_Only_HTTP_GET_Flag = ${NTCIP2306_N2R6_WSDL_Request_Only_HTTP_GET_Flag}

Step 5 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the XML over HTTP sub-profile Request-Response pattern is required by the specification. (NRTM 2.b). RECORD this information as: NTCIP2306_N2R7_WSDL_Request_Response_HTTP_POST_Flag = ${NTCIP2306_N2R7_WSDL_Request_Response_HTTP_POST_Flag}

Step 6 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the XML over FTP sub-profile Request-Only pattern is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.a). RECORD this information as: NTCIP2306_N3R11_WSDL_Request_Only_FTP_GET_Flag = ${NTCIP2306_N3R11_WSDL_Request_Only_FTP_GET_Flag}

Step 7 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the SOAP over HTTP sub-profile HTTPS transport is required by the specification. (NRTM 1.d.2). RECORD this information as: NTCIP2306_N1R5_Message_Transport_HTTPS_Flag = ${NTCIP2306_N1R5_Message_Transport_HTTPS_Flag}

Step 8 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the XML over HTTP sub-profile HTTPS transport is required by the specification. (NRTM 2.e.2). RECORD this information as: NTCIP2306_N2R10_Message_Transport_HTTPS_Flag = ${NTCIP2306_N2R10_Message_Transport_HTTPS_Flag}
Step 9 VERIFY that the specified WSDL file exists.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: A center that provides a service to one or more external centers, and/or expects the external center to implement a service (e.g., a subscriber callback listener) shall document the services using WSDL.

testStep.functionId: Step 10 VALIDATE the WSDL file using the W3C WSDL 1.1 Schema

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The version of WSDL shall conform with W3C WSDL 1.1.

testStep.functionId: Step 11 VERIFY that the WSDL file consists of 5 child sections: types/schema, message, portType, binding, service.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The WSDL definitions shall consists of 5 child sections as follows: a) types/schema b) message c) portType d) binding e) service

testStep.functionId: Step 12 VERIFY that the definitions tag includes a name attribute.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The definitions tag shall include a name attribute.

testStep.functionId: Step 13 VERIFY that the type section begins with the types tag.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The type section shall begin with the types tag

testStep.functionId: Step 14 VERIFY that the schema tag immediately follows the types tag.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The schema tag shall immediately follow the types tag.

testStep.functionId: Step 15 VERIFY that the import tag follows the types tag and specifies any namespace being imported and the schemaLocation.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The import tag shall follow and specify the namespace being imported and the schemaLocation, i.e., the name (or URL) of the XML Schema file.

testStep.functionId: Step 16 If NTCIP2306_N1R1_WSDL_Request_Response_Flag is equal to True CONTINUE; Otherwise skip the following substeps. Note: If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.
Step 16.1 VERIFY that the message section includes the top-level messages defined in the XML Schema that apply to the project implementation and use a Request-Response transmission pattern.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The message section shall specify all top-level messages defined in the XML Schema that apply to the project implementation and used a request-response transmission pattern.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.2 VERIFY that each message name is defined by the name of the message type, as defined in the schema, with the prefix [MSG_] at the front part of the name.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The message name shall be defined by the name of the message type, as defined in the schema, with the prefix ?MSG_? at the front part of the name.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.3 VERIFY that the name attribute of each message part is set to [message].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The name attribute of the message part shall always ?message?.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.4 VERIFY that the element attribute of the message part name starts with a prefix of the form [tmdd:].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The element attribute of the message part name shall use the form [tmdd:] followed by the name of the XML Schema element being imported into the WSDL.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.5 VERIFY that at least one binding tag is followed by a soap:binding tag.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The binding tag shall be followed by a soap:binding tag.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.6 VERIFY that portType tag (or multiple) exists and contains a list of SOAP operation tags. There must be at least one operation for each portType element.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The portType tag shall be the parent tag for a list of operations supported by the SOAP Service for the specific project implementation.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.7 VERIFY that each operation name begins with the [OP_] prefix.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The operation name shall begin with the prefix [OP_] followed by a descriptive name for the operation.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.8 VERIFY that each operation has one input tag followed by one output tag.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: Each operation shall have one input and one output tag. The input tag is specified first followed by the output tag.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.9 VERIFY that the input message references a message defined in the Message section of the WSDL. The prefix for the message part of the operation must be [tns:].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The input message shall reference a message defined in the Message section of the WSDL. To reference a message inside the WSDL, the message part of the operation shall begin with the prefix ?tns:? followed by the name of the message specified in the Message section of the WSDL.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.10 VERIFY that the style attribute of all soap:binding tags is [document].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The style attribute of the soap:binding tag shall be ?document?

testStep.functionId: Step 16.11 VERIFY that the transport attribute of all soap:binding tags is [http://schemas.xmloap.org/soap/http].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The transport attribute of the soap:binding tag shall be ?http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http?

testStep.functionId: Step 16.12 VERIFY that each the operation name matches at least one operation specified in the portType section(s) of the WSDL.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The operation name must match the operation as specified in the portType section of the WSDL for each operation supported by the center.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.13 VERIFY that the operation tag following a soap:binding tag is followed by the soap:operation tag.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The operation tag shall be followed by the soap:operation tag.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.14 VERIFY that the soapAction attribute exists within each soap:operation tag. Confirm that the soapAction attribute is either written as two double quotes that enclose to single quote characters or as two double quotes that enclose a URL that indicates the message handler for the endpoint.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The soapAction attribute specifies the soapAction which the external center requester must included within an HTTP header. There is no requirement for a soapAction, only that the attribute be present. However, if no soapAction is specified, the soapAction attribute must by written as a double quote followed by two consecutive single quote characters followed by a double quote (????). The soapAction shall be a URL that indicates the message handler for the endpoint.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.15 VERIFY that the soap:operation tag is followed by an input tag set.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The soap:operation tag shall be followed by a input /input tag set.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.16 VERIFY that the input tag is followed by a soap:body tag with a use attribute set to [literal].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The input tag shall be followed by a soap:body tag. The use attribute of the soap:body tag shall be ?literal?. This specifies that the message content of the SOAP message is an XML message that conforms with the XML Schema referenced in the schema section of the WSDL, which in turn is enclosed between a soap:envelope and soap:body tags.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.17 VERIFY that the input tag within the soap:operation tag is followed by an output tag set.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The input tag set shall be followed by an output tag set

testStep.functionId: Step 16.18 VERIFY that the output tag is followed by a soap:body tag with a use attribute set to [literal].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The output tag shall be followed by a soap:body tag. The use attribute of the soap:body tag shall be ?literal?.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.19 VERIFY that each service tag contains a name attribute.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The service tag shall contain a name attribute of the service.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.20 VERIFY that the service tag is followed by a port tag. If the service tag includes a documentation tag, it must precede the port tag.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The port tag shall follow the documentation tag, if one is present. The name attribute of the port tag will reflect the name of a SOAP port followed by the binding attribute indicating the name of the binding identified in the bindings section which applies.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.21 VERIFY that a soap:address tag follows a port tag. There should be at least one present in the WSDL. Verify that the port tag contains a location attribute.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: Following the port tag, a soap:address tag shall be placed. The location attribute of the soap:address tag shall specify the service endpoint of the SOAP service.

testStep.functionId: Step 16.22 VERIFY that the location attribute of the soap:address tag specifies a valid URL.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The service endpoint must specify a valid URL.

testStep.functionId: Step 17 If NTCIP2306_N1R2_WSDL_Subscription_Publication_Flag is equal to True CONTINUE; Otherwise skip the following substeps. Note: If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.
Step 17.1 VERIFY that message section contains all top-level messages defined in the XML Schema that apply to the project implementation and are used as a subscription message.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The message section shall specify all top-level messages defined in the XML Schema that apply to the project implementation and used as a subscription message.

testStep.functionId: Step 17.2 VERIFY that each message name is defined by the name of the message type, as defined in the schema, with the prefix [MSG_] at the front part of the name.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The message name shall be defined by the name of the message type, as defined in the schema, with the prefix ?MSG_? at the front part of the name.

testStep.functionId: Step 17.3 VERIFY that the message has 2 parts. The name attribute of the first part shall always be [c2cMsgAdmin], and the element attribute is [c2c:c2cMessageSubscription].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The message shall have 2 parts. The name attribute of the first message part shall always be ?c2cMsgAdmin?, and the elemen attribute ?c2c:c2cMessageSubscription?.

testStep.functionId: Step 17.4 VERIFY that the name attribute of the second message part is set to [message] and the element attribute uses the form [tmdd:] followed by the name of the XML Schema element being imported into the WSDL.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The name attribute of the second message part shall be ?message? and the element attribute use the form ?tmdd:? followed by the name of the XML Schema element being imported into the WSDL.

testStep.functionId: Step 17.5 VERIFY that the message section specifies all top-level messages defined in the XML Schema that apply to the project implementation and are used as publication messages.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The message section shall specify all top-level messages defined in the XML Schema that apply to the project implementation and used as a publication message.

testStep.functionId: Step 17.6 VERIFY that each message name begins with the prefix [MSG_]. Also, confirm that the remainder of the message exists within the schema.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The message name shall be defined by the name of the message type, as defined in the schema, with the prefix ?MSG_? at the front part of the name.

testStep.functionId: Step 17.7 VERIFY that the message has 2 parts. The name attribute of the first part shall always be [c2cMsgAdmin], and the element attribute is [c2c:c2cMessagePublication].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The message shall have 2 parts. The name attribute of the first message part shall always be ?c2cMsgAdmin?, and the element attribute ?c2c:c2cMessagePublication?.

testStep.functionId: Step 17.8 VERIFY that the name attribute of the second message part is set to [message] and the element uses the form [tmdd:] followed by the name of the XML Schema element being imported into the WSDL.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The name attribute of the second message part shall be ?message? and the element attribute use the form ?tmdd:? followed by the name of the XML Schema element being imported into the WSDL.

testStep.functionId: Step 17.9 VERIFY that the WSDL file contains a specification(s) for a subscriber callback listener.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The publication center shall specify the WSDL for the subscriber callback listener.

testStep.functionId: Step 17.10 VERIFY that the subscription and publication operations use the same XML encoding and transmission message patterns.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The WSDL (created by the publication center) shall show that subscription and publication use the same XML encoding and transmission message patterns (SOAP over HTTP or XML over HTTP).

testStep.functionId: Step 17.11 VERIFY that the portType tag is followed by a list of operations supported by the subscriber for listening for asynchronous SOAP message delivery.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The portType tag shall be followed by a list of operations supported by the subscriber for listening for asynchronous SOAP message delivery.

testStep.functionId: Step 17.12 VERIFY that the list of operations a subscriber listener must support are defined in the WSDL.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The list of operations a subscriber listener must support shall be defined by the publishing center and documented in the publication center?s WSDL

testStep.functionId: Step 17.13 VERIFY that the operation name, input message and output message follow the same rules as those defined for a SOAP Request-Response portType defined in Section 7.1.3. *** Error in Spec: Should reference 7.1.1 ***

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The operation name, input message, and output message follow the same rules as those defined for a SOAP Request-Response portType defined in Section 7.1.3.

testStep.functionId: Step 17.14 VERIFY that each callback message is defined as an input message.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The callback message (sent from the publisher to subscriber) shall be defined as an ?input message? (from the subscriber?s perspective).

testStep.functionId: Step 17.15 VERIFY that the subscriber response is defined in the output message.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The subscriber shall respond with an acknowledge message (if defined) or an HTTP error code, which shall be defined in the ?output message?.

testStep.functionId: Step 17.16 VERIFY that the normative rules from the SOAP Request-Response Binding defined in Section 7.1.3 apply with the exception that the soapAction attribute will be left blank.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The normative rules from the SOAP Request-Response Binding defined in Section 7.1.3 shall apply with the following exception?the ?soapAction? attribute shall be left blank, to be specified during subscription.

testStep.functionId: Step 17.17 VERIFY that the service tag contains a name attribute of the service.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The service tag shall contain a name attribute of the service.

testStep.functionId: Step 17.18 VERIFY that the port tag follows the documentation tag, if one is present. The name attribute of the port tag reflects the name of a SOAP port followed by the binding attribute indicating the binding attribute indicating the name

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The port tag shall follow the documentation tag, if one is present. The name attribute of the port tag will reflect the name of a SOAP port followed by the binding attribute indicating the name of the binding identified in the bindings section which applies.

testStep.functionId: Step 17.19 VERIFY that following the port tag, a soap:address tags is present.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: Following the port tag, a soap:address tag shall be placed. The location attribute of the soap:address tag shall specify a fake (place holder ) service endpoint of the SOAP service, which contains the subscriber callback listener. However, to support valid WSDL, the soap:address tag must be included. The subscriber shall provide an end point at run-time as described in Section 7.1.2 covering Subscription.

testStep.functionId: Step 18 If NTCIP2306_N2R7_WSDL_Request_Response_HTTP_POST_Flag is equal to True CONTINUE; Otherwise skip the following substeps. Note: If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.
Step 18.1 VERIFY that the message section includes the top-level messages defined in the XML Schema that apply to the project implementation and use a Request-Response transmission pattern.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The message section shall specify all top-level messages defined in the XML Schema that apply to the project implementation and used a request-response transmission pattern.

testStep.functionId: Step 18.2 VERIFY that each message name is defined by the name of the message type, as defined in the schema, with the prefix [MSG_] at the front part of the name.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The message name shall be defined by the name of the message type, as defined in the schema, with the prefix ?MSG_? at the front part of the name.

testStep.functionId: Step 18.3 VERIFY that the name attribute of each message part is set to [message].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The name attribute of the message part shall always ?message?.

testStep.functionId: Step 18.4 VERIFY that the element attribute of the message part name starts with a prefix of the form [tmdd:].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The element attribute of the message part name shall use the form [tmdd:] followed by the name of the XML Schema element being imported into the WSDL.

testStep.functionId: Step 18.5 VERIFY that the portType section for XML over HTTP follows the same rules as those in Section 7.1.1.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The portType section for XML over HTTP follows the same rules as those in Section 7.1.1.

testStep.functionId: Step 18.6 VERIFY that the requirement of the Request Only Binding is applied.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The same requirement of the Request Only Binding shall apply.

testStep.functionId: Step 18.7 VERIFY that the content of the input tag contains at least one form parameter, which contains an XML message.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The content of the input tag shall contain at least one form parameter, which shall contain an XML message.

testStep.functionId: Step 18.8 VERIFY that the rules for a SOAP service are applied except for exceptions listed in this section.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The rules that apply are the same as those specified for a SOAP Service with the following exception:

testStep.functionId: Step 18.9 VERIFY that the XML HTTP endpoint uses the http:address tag to specify an endpoint rather than the soap:address tag.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The XML HTTP endpoint uses the http:address tag to specify an endpoint rather than the soap:address tag.

testStep.functionId: Step 19 If NTCIP2306_N2R6_WSDL_Request_Only_HTTP_GET_Flag is equal to True CONTINUE; Otherwise skip the following substeps. Note: If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.
Step 19.1 VERIFY that the message section includes the top-level messages defined in the XML Schema that apply to the project implementation and are used in a one-way transmission pattern.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The message section shall specify all top-level messages defined in the XML Schema that apply to the project implementation and used a request-response transmission pattern.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.2 VERIFY that each message name is defined by the name of the message type, as defined in the schema, with the prefix [MSG_] at the front part of the name.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The message name shall be defined by the name of the message type, as defined in the schema, with the prefix ?MSG_? at the front part of the name.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.3 VERIFY that the name attribute of each message part is set to [message].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The name attribute of the message part shall always ?message?.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.4 VERIFY that the element attribute of the message part name starts with a prefix of the form [tmdd:].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The element attribute of the message part name shall use the form [tmdd:] followed by the name of the XML Schema element being imported into the WSDL.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.5 VERIFY that the WSDL to describe the simple retrieval of a file is described as a one-way operation.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The WSDL to describe the simple retrieval of a file shall be described as a one-way operation.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.6 VERIFY that the portType tag is followed by a single operation which maps to a specific file.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The portType tag shall be followed by a single operation that maps to a specific file.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.7 VERIFY that the operation is defined as a one way operation.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The operation shall be a one-way operation between the data provider center and the external center (data consumer).

testStep.functionId: Step 19.8 VERIFY that the operation name begins with the prefix [OP_] followed by a name for the operation.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The operation name shall begin with the prefix ?OP_? followed by a descriptive name for the operation.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.9 VERIFY that each operation has one input tag.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: Each operation shall have one input tag.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.10 VERIFY that the binding tag is followed by a http:binding tag.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The binding tag shall be followed by a http:binding tag.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.11 VERIFY that at least one section contains a http:binding verb attribute set to [GET].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The http:binding verb attribute shall be ?GET?.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.12 VERIFY that the operation name matches the operation as specified in the portType section of the WSDL for each operation (file) supported by the center.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The operation name shall match the operation as specified in the portType section of the WSDL for each operation (file) supported by the center.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.13 VERIFY that the operation tag is followed by the http:operation tag.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The operation tag shall be followed by the http:operation tag.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.14 VERIFY that the location attribute shall be the name of the file. The name of the file is to be defined by each center. However, it is recommended that the file name reflect the name of the message or messages contained. Documentation outlining these naming rules should be established and a link provided to it in the meta-data of the documentation section.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The location attribute shall be the name of the file. The name of the file is to be defined by each center. However, it is recommended that the file name reflect the name of the message or messages contained. Documentation outlining these naming rules should be established and a link provided to it in the meta-data of the documentation section.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.15 VERIFY that the http:operation tag is followed by the input ,/input tag set.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The http:operation tag shall be followed by the input /input tag set.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.16 VERIFY that the input tag is followed by a http:urlEncoded tag.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The input tag shall be followed by a http:urlEncoded tag.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.17 VERIFY that the input tag set is followed by an output, /output tag set.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The input tag set shall be followed by an output /output tag set.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.18 VERIFY that the output tag is followed by a mime:content tag.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The output tag shall be followed by a mime:content tag.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.19 VERIFY that the valid type attribute of the mime:content tag is any MIME type.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The valid type attribute of the mime:content tag shall be any MIME type.

testStep.functionId: Step 19.20 VERIFY that the rules for a SOAP service are applied except for exceptions listed in this section.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The rules that apply are the same as those specified for a SOAP Service with the following exception:

testStep.functionId: Step 19.21 VERIFY that the XML HTTP endpoint uses the http:address tag to specify an endpoint rather than the soap:address tag.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The XML HTTP endpoint uses the http:address tag to specify an endpoint rather than the soap:address tag.

testStep.functionId: Step 20 If NTCIP2306_N3R11_WSDL_Request_Only_FTP_GET_Flag is equal to True CONTINUE; Otherwise skip the following substeps. Note: If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.
Step 20.1 VERIFY that the message section includes the top-level messages defined in the XML Schema that apply to the project implementation and are used in a one-way transmission pattern.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The message section shall specify all top-level messages defined in the XML Schema that apply to the project implementation and used a request-response transmission pattern.

testStep.functionId: Step 20.2 VERIFY that each message name is defined by the name of the message type, as defined in the schema, with the prefix [MSG_] at the front part of the name.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The message name shall be defined by the name of the message type, as defined in the schema, with the prefix ?MSG_? at the front part of the name.

testStep.functionId: Step 20.3 VERIFY that the name attribute of each message part is set to [message].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The name attribute of the message part shall always ?message?.

testStep.functionId: Step 20.4 VERIFY that the element attribute of the message part name starts with a prefix of the form [tmdd:].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The element attribute of the message part name shall use the form [tmdd:] followed by the name of the XML Schema element being imported into the WSDL.

testStep.functionId: Step 20.5 VERIFY that the operation name and output message follow the same rules as those defined for a SOAP Service portType.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The operation name and output message follow the same rules as those defined for a SOAP Service portType.

testStep.functionId: Step 20.6 VERIFY that the operation name matches the operation as specified in the portType section of the WSDL for each operation (file) supported by the center.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The operation name shall match the operation as specified in the portType section of the WSDL for each operation (file) supported by the center.

testStep.functionId: Step 20.7 VERIFY that the operation tag is followed by the ftp:operation tag.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The operation tag shall be followed by the ftp:operation tag.

testStep.functionId: Step 20.8 VERIFY that the location attribute is the name of the file. The name of the file is to be defined by each center.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The location attribute shall be the name of the file. The name of the file is to be defined by each center. However, it is recommended that the file name reflect the name of the message or messages contained.

testStep.functionId: Step 20.9 VERIFY that the ftp:operation tag is followed by the input ,/input tag set.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The ftp:operation tag shall be followed by the input /input tag set.

testStep.functionId: Step 20.10 VERIFY that the input tag is followed by a ftp:urlEncoded tag.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The input tag shall be followed by a ftp:urlEncoded tag.

testStep.functionId: Step 20.11 VERIFY that the input tag set is followed by an output, /output tag set.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The input tag set shall be followed by an output /output tag set.

testStep.functionId: Step 20.12 VERIFY that the output tag is followed by a mime:content tag. The valid type attribute of the mime:content tag is MIME type supported by the center server (assuming that the center MIME types are also valid per the FTP specification).

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The output tag shall be followed by a mime:content tag. The valid type attribute of the mime:content tag shall be MIME type supported by the center server (assuming that the center MIME types are also valid per the FTP specification). Example MIME types include: ?gzip? for zip-encoded compressed data, ?text/xml? for an XML Document, and ?image/jpeg? or ?image/gif? for image data. If the ?gzip? MIME type is included, the compressed information must be XML.

testStep.functionId: Step 20.13 VERIFY that the XML FTP endpoint uses the ftp:address tag to specify an endpoint rather than the soap:address tag.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The XML FTP endpoint uses the ftp:address tag to specify an endpoint rather than the soap:address tag.

testStep.functionId: Step 20.14 VERIFY that the address is a valid URL.

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: The address shall be a valid URL.

testStep.functionId: Step 21 IF NTCIP2306_N1R5_Message_Transport_HTTPS_Flag is equal to True CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps. Note: If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.
Step 21.1 VERIFY that one (or more) service endpoints of the WSDL file use [https:].

ri-verify-WSDL.functionId: A HTTPS service endpoint shall be specified by using ?https:? instead of ?http:? as the transport protocol.

Step 22.1 VERIFY that one (or more) service endpoints of the WSDL file use [https:] .
